meanings.definition: To know or be aware of something.
meanings.sent1: She wotted the answer to the question.
meanings.sent2: I wotted that the store closes at 9 pm.
meanings.sent3: The cat wotted the mouse hiding behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: He wotted the danger lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The detective wotted the clue that cracked the case.

meanings.definition: To have knowledge or information about something.
meanings.sent1: They wotted the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: We wotted about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The robot wotted all the data in its memory banks.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl wotted the secrets of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher wotted the correct answer to every question.
